strings.Value: "Tests? What tests?"
"I should go now."
"The wererat died from taking the potion."
[Lie] "As soon as I fed your potion to the dog... spots appeared on it from head to tail! And then it had orange saliva dripping from its mouth!"
"I need to buy something from you."
"What formula?"
"I bet a gold piece that you're not even listening to what I say…"
"Speak clearly, old man. What on earth are you blathering about?"
"The potion clouded your mind. You attacked me."
"You've dared to raise your hand against your ruler. Beg now for your life."
"Not bad. But I'm going to kill you anyway."
"That's more like it."
"No, Bokken. Svetlana is worried about you – and I can see she's right to be. You are obsessed with this idea. It won't lead anywhere good."
"All right, I'll do it."
"Shut up, you nitwit… and next time think before you take any more potions."
"I'm not tormenting living creatures for the sake of your ambition!"
"Your potion made the dog go mad and attack me!"
"I didn't get to torment the wererat with your toxic potion."
{n}{d|Bokken}Bokken{/d} looks tired and haggard. His face is grey, his brow furrowed, and his eyes shine with a feverish glow.{/n} "Who's there? What is it?"
"Oh, it's you! How convenient! I need your help – we have to run some tests…"
"I've found the formula! All on my own! These damned books didn't have it – nothing but hints and half-truths there. But you can't fool old Bokken that easily, he he heh…"
"Is that so? Hmm… The wererat simply died, and the mutt gone rabid… You see, my potion wasn't meant to do anything with the mind. Only the body!"
{n}Bokken squints his eyes, looking at you with barely hidden irritation.{/n} "You lie... I can smell a lie when I hear one!"
{n}Bokken blinks at you, clearly surprised.{/n} "Orange saliva? But wait… what's that, then? This potion wasn't meant to make such changes to the body..."
"Well?"
{n}The old man's eyes are beginning to clear. It seems that he's coming back to his senses.{/n}
"We'll need to go for one final test, it seems. We must try the potion on a human. An elf would do just fine as well. Or a dwarf... or…"
"Why would I? Though I can hear you clear as day… Now, what was I saying, then? Oh, right – the formula!"

"The elixir of eternal youth! A most wondrous brew – restores the strength in one's hands and the swiftness in one's feet. I first heard of it when I was still just a lad, and I didn't believe in it. But now I've lived a long life, and I've seen even stranger things. So I thought: why not give it a try?"
"What… what happened?"
"Oh, please, forgive me, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}! How the devil… It's all that damned potion's fault, I swear! It stole my mind, that wasn't me, I swear…"
"Gods… Forgive an old man. I didn't know what I was doing…"

{n}Bokken wipes the sweat off his brow.{/n} "I never thought that potion could work in such a way… but still, it does seem to make one stronger! Thank you for all your help! Now I know how to iron out the wrinkles – I think…"

"So I asked you to find these books for me. – I'd heard that one of the volumes contains a formula. Well, it turns out they don't. All they do is make things clear as mud. Still, I was able to find something useful in there… I can't remember how many nights I stayed up working on the solution, but here it is!" {n}Bokken proudly shows you a few vials filled with silvery liquid.{/n}
"Can't drink it yet, though. Must test it first… Can't be too careful with these things." {n}Bokken gives you an expectant look.{/n} "So will you help me?"
{n}Bokken is almost shaking with indignation.{/n} "So that's how it is, is it?! That mischievous schemer… Fine. I'll just make it on my own. It won't be the first time!"

"Wonderful! Thanks for that! Let's try it on a dog first. There's a mutt on a leash around the corner… you can test the stuff on it. I won't feel bad for it if something goes wrong! That'll teach it to stop barking at me every time I pass by! I could do it myself, but what if it's off the leash? It won't harm you as it would harm me!"
{n}Bokken takes a small glass vial from his pocket. He exhales sharply, takes a few gulps – and the vial is empty!{/n}
{n}Backing away in terror, Bokken whispers, his voice barely audible.{/n} "Thank you for your help! Now I know what's wrong with the formula. I can take it from here…"
{n}Bokken is practically shaking with indignation.{/n} "So that's how it is, is it?! Fine. I'll just make it on my own. Won't be the first time!"

"To the demons with the dog. We need someone more human to experiment on. Know what? My neighbor, a hunter, once told me he saw wererats in a forest not far from here. They'd make better test subjects. After all, they're closer to humans than a dog. We should find them and try again... but take this vial. This potion has a different, improved formula."
"A mad dog? Sounds wrong, very wrong... I must have made a mistake."
